intro: Agrimonia pilosa var. zeylanica, commonly known as the Zeylanic agrimony, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia, including India and Sri Lanka. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped, serrated, and covered with a dense layer of fine pubescence. Agrimonia pilosa var. zeylanica is often found in moist meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial to full sunlight.
